ai-patthana24.3:0.2_0: under the investigation of the Dhamma: Protector of the World, circumstances, and tangledges of clothes.
ai-patthana24.3:2.1_0: The three objects of respective objects, the three divine abidings expanded, and the three suitable for one (to say).
ai-patthana24.3:3.1_0: You don’t give rise to the cause or reason for this.
ai-patthana24.3:3.1_1: ‘... for the sake of conditioned things.’ ...
ai-patthana24.3:3.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana24.3:4.1_0: Not for the sake of this teaching is not the cause, and condition for the sake of the teaching,
ai-patthana24.3:4.1_1: The three (goods) have been planted in brief, and the three watches of the night, when there was none, it was although non-disappearance at all.
ai-patthana24.3:5.1_0: or to someone without resentment gives rise to causes and reasons.
ai-patthana24.3:5.1_1: ‘... for the sake of conditioned things.’ ...
ai-patthana24.3:5.1_2: one person is building up one another while mutually saying:
ai-patthana24.3:5.1_3: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana24.3:6.1_0: One should not give rise to repulsion causes condition for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana24.3:6.1_1: ‘This is the reason why foundation of one kind’ ...
ai-patthana24.3:7.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana24.3:8.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana24.3:9.1_0: Experiential confidence in the teaching, without the teaching,
ai-patthana24.3:9.1_1: One doesn’t give rise to the teaching for the sake of worldly conditions.
ai-patthana24.3:9.1_3: ‘... for the sake of conditioned things.’ ...
ai-patthana24.3:9.1_4: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana24.3:10.1_0: or delight in the supermundane, there is no cause or condition for the sake of the world.
ai-patthana24.3:10.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana24.3:11.1_0: I won’t give rise to a teaching for someone who understands the sake of another, or for someone who understands the rules.
ai-patthana24.3:12.1_0: One should not ask for the sake of deceiving nature, or without cause or reason.
